main event: Multiple Air Force personnel at Keesler AFB, Mississippi, observed approximately ten bright metallic objects flying in a diamond formation in 1952. The objects were oval or round in shape, made no noise, and left no trail.
interesting points: The sighting was made by multiple Air Force personnel, adding credibility to the report.
The objects were observed flying in a diamond formation, a unique and unusual flight pattern.
The objects were estimated to be traveling at a high speed of 600 to 800 miles per hour.
The observation was confirmed by the control tower, providing additional verification of the sighting.
Despite the observation of multiple objects for about five minutes, there were no fragments or photographic evidence of the event.
sighted object: bright metallic objects in a diamond formation
